English: same as `斑竹~[ban1 zhu2], mottled bamboo, since according to legend the spots on mottled bamboo are marks left by the tears shed by two of King Shun's `舜~[Shun4] concubines (Ehuang `娥皇~[E2 huanɡ2] and Nüying `女英~[Nü3 yinɡ1], known as the Concubines of the Xiang `湘妃~[Xiang1 Fei1]) upon learning of his death
